result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for GAVIN C BATLEY
Current: 123 W. Huron St Unit F, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 04-07-2022)
Prior: 473 Bluff St, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States

11:45 AM Defendant GAVIN C BATLEY in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for GAVIN C BATLEY. Court calls 21CM119, 21CM196, and 22CM4. Court recites offer in 21CM119 will recommend probation, jail, aoda, costs, and conditions, 21CM196 probation, and will dismiss and read in 22CM4.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support each of the pleas. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 in 21CM119 and dismisses and reads in count 2, in 21CM196 Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and dismisses and reads in count 2 and will dismiss and read in 22CM4. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Sentencing statement by DA Laspisa. Sentencing statement by Atty Kapelis. Sentencing statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

21CM119 (Count 1): -90 days county jail stayed and places on probation for 1 year, concurrent to each other. No huber, out of county service or out of county travel.
21CM196 (Count 1): -SWD, and places on probation for 1 year, concurrent to each other.

CONDITIONS

-AODA and any follow-up. 
-Mental Health Assessment and any follow-up. If what the defendant has already done is equal to or better than what the Department of Corrections can provide with your psychiatrist I won't make you do it again. That's up to the probation officer.
-Defendant is to take all medications as prescribed.
-Defendant is to have No Violent Contact with his parents or any other family members. 
-Court Costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.  
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 
-Defendant is to complete the GED or HSED.
-If defendant is able do all of the conditions and get no further criminal charges and is able to maintain his own living, that is, he is paying his rent and is doing it without help from anybody, with the completion of the GED or HSED then the Court will grant expungement.  

Court adjourned at 12:02 PM.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.

NOT ON THE RECORD

 Defendant GAVIN C BATLEY appeared by video, Attorney Michael J Kapelis appeared in court for GAVIN C BATLEY, Attorney Matthew McElroy appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states he has discovery and no offer and is pursing a global offer and requests another court date. Court schedules plea/sentencing for  April 5, 2022 at 11:30. Mandatory Appearance.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely
Letter to the Court from Atty Kapelis dated Feb 25, 2022 re: request for def to appear via zoom.

8:50 AM Defendant GAVIN C BATLEY appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Michael J Kapelis appeared in court for GAVIN C BATLEY, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court goes over bonds in the cases, only 2022CM4 has a cash bond. Statement by Atty Kapelis regarding modification of bond. Statement by DA Laspisa, does not object but has concerns. Court questions defendant if he will go there. Statement by defendant - states he will. Court amends bond to a signature bond and allows the defendant to go to treatment to Rogers Memorial Hospital as in-patient and if he leaves the bond will be converted to a cash bond.

9:40 AM Defendant GAVIN C BATLEY appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Brad Bollmann appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via video. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Defendant stands mute. Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant. ADA makes bond recommendation. Statement by C.B. Court sets bond at $10,000 cash bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department if not already completed. Court will set for Status Hearing on March 1, 2022 at 2:30 PM.

Court adjourned at 9:44 AM
